awd_titl_txt: Neural Networks for Selecting Resource-Constrained Project  Scheduling Heuristics
awd_abstract_narration: Resource-constrained project scheduling with cash flows is                      difficult due to the large number of possible combinations of                   tasks which can generate feasible schedules.  This had led to the               evolution of a variety of heuristic procedures that can aid the                 generation of a near-optimal schedule.  Choosing the best heuristic             is difficult because it depends upon the particular problem;                    furthermore often a combination of heuristics is better; finally                since circumstances can change, real-time adjustment of the                     scheduling solution is important.  Hence the proposer will analyze              the feasibility of using neural networks in the selection of the                best heuristic algorithm for the resource-constrained project                   scheduling problem.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
